intro: Psychotria grandistipula, commonly known as the large-tipped psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria grandistipula is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
